Metaphor:EMOTIONAL INTENSITY IS TEMPERATURE

Jump to: navigation, search
Name Gloss EMOTIONAL INTENSITY IS TEMPERATURE
Name Transcription
Aliases

EMOTIONAL INTENSITY IS HEAT (Grady (1998))

Description
Comments
Tags
Family Emotion Metaphors, Scalar Metaphors, Grady Primary Metaphors
Metaphor Level General
Metaphor Type Primary
Experiential Basis
Cultural Scope
Source Frame Heat
Roles:entity, heat_level
Target Frame Emotional intensity
Roles:emotional_intensity_x-schema, emotional_intensity_scale


Mappings:

emotional_intensity_scale <= heat_level

Related Metaphors:

Current Metaphor EMOTIONAL INTENSITY IS TEMPERATURE
Relation Type is related to
Related Metaphor ANGER IS HEAT
Description

Entailments:

Target Entailment Having intense emotion
Source Inference Experiencing intense body heat
Type of Inferential Structure scalar
Entailed Metaphor(s) EMOTIONALLY INTENSE IS HOT
Target Entailment Having mild or average emotions
Source Inference Experiencing average body temperature
Type of Inferential Structure scalar
Entailed Metaphor(s) EMOTIONALLY MILD IS EXPERIENCING MILD TEMPERATURE
Target Entailment Having no emotions
Source Inference Experiencing below average body temperature
Type of Inferential Structure scalar
Entailed Metaphor(s) EMOTIONALLY INDIFFERENT IS COLD

Examples:

Example Text: As the argument continued, things really heated up.

We need better mappings but that would mean that heat would have to have an x-schema to map to the emotional intensity one...Eve

EntailmentHaving intense emotion (Experiencing intense body heat, scalar, EMOTIONALLY INTENSE IS HOT) +, Having mild or average emotions (Experiencing average body temperature, scalar, EMOTIONALLY MILD IS EXPERIENCING MILD TEMPERATURE) + and Having no emotions (Experiencing below average body temperature, scalar, EMOTIONALLY INDIFFERENT IS COLD) +
